unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Boosts Post-Diwali Demand**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Boosts Post-Diwali Demand**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – As Indian manufacturers ramp up production to meet post-Diwali demand, quality control (QC) is taking center stage. Industry experts at IIT-Delhi emphasize the critical role of robust QC measures in ensuring customer satisfaction and minimizing costly recalls.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – As Indian manufacturers ramp up production to meet post-Diwali demand, quality control (Q C) is taking center stage. Industry experts at I I T-Delhi emphasize the critical role of robust Q C measures in ensuring customer satisfaction and minimizing costly recalls.

unnormalised: "Imagine a batch of 'ladoos' prepared for Onam being substandard; the reputational damage can be significant,” notes Dr. Meena Krishnan, Head of Supply Chain Management at IIM Bangalore. She further explained that failing to maintain QC standards during periods of high output is a recurring issue, with potential impacts on everything from automotive parts to textiles.

She further explained that failing to maintain Q C standards during periods of high output is a recurring issue, with potential impacts on everything from automotive parts to textiles.

unnormalised: Many companies are now investing in advanced QC technologies, including AI-powered inspection systems, to detect defects early in the production process. This move promises to reduce wastage and ensure that only high-quality goods, whether electronics or even biryani spice blends, reach consumers. Proper quality control can improve process efficiency by upto 15%. Rs. 5 Crore has been allocated to improving QC measures in the textile sector alone.
